Peaches and Shaved Fennel Salad Recipe | Bon Appétit

Make breakfast an occasion by serving this salad alongside breakfast calzones, marinated beans with ricotta salata, and torta pasqualina.Ingredients8 servings5large peaches (about 2 lb. total), cut into ½"-thick wedges3Tbsp. Chardonnay vinegar or white wine vinegar, dividedKosher salt1small fennel bulb, halved, very thinly sliced on a mandoline, plus coarsely chopped fennel fronds1Tbsp. fresh lemon juiceExtra-virgin olive oil (for drizzling)Aleppo-style or other mild red pepper flakes (for serving)PreparationStep 1Toss peaches in a large bowl with 2 Tbsp. vinegar and pinch of salt to coat. Arrange peaches on a platter and spoon any juices left in bowl over top.Step 2Toss fennel in the same bowl with lemon juice and remaining 1 Tbsp. vinegar to coat; season with salt.Step 3Scatter dressed fennel and fennel fronds over peaches on platter and drizzle with oil. Sprinkle with some red pepper flakes.How would you rate Peaches and Shaved Fennel Salad with Red Pepper?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (1)Back to TopTriangleSweet zesty bright and little bit of spice. Delicious side to our salmon, we used champagne vinegar because it was we had. This shaved fennel and peaches blended nicely with grilled salmon. The lemon was a nice balance and we used hatch green Chile flakes, as that is what we have as well.
